intro: Utricularia aureolimba, commonly known as the golden limbed bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and specialized bladder-like structures used to trap prey. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this plant typically grows in aquatic or semi-aquatic environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, adding to its visual appeal. The plant's unique adaptations for nutrient acquisition make it an interesting subject in botanical studies.
